attributes.action: All UK Schools/colleges should have knife/general crimes prevention lessons
attributes.additional_details: Many knife crimes happening around UK. Schools/colleges should have knife crime/general crimes prevention lessons,teaching students how it will ruin their life and how it will affect their families,possible long prison sentences. students will have fear and better understanding.  government should make this lesson as law in UK.
attributes.background: Government should make knife/ general crimes prevention lessons as a legal requirement in all colleges and schools, it may reduce crimes

rejection.details:
Schools are already required to teach about the role of law and the justice system in our society and how laws are shaped and enforced, as part of the citizenship curriculum, which is mandatory in Key stages 3 and 4: https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/national-curriculum-in-england-citizenship-programmes-of-study/national-curriculum-in-england-citizenship-programmes-of-study-for-key-stages-3-and-4

We have published the following petition, which you might like to sign:

Require schools teach students about knife crime in Year 8 and 9: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/616968
